text:
9.2 ğŸ“‚ Creating an R Script and Committing Changes

Open GitHub Desktop and click Clone a Repository.
Select your repository and choose a local directory.
Open RStudio and create a new file named hello.R.
Add the following content:
print("Hello R world!")
Save the file and return to GitHub Desktop.
You should see the file listed under Changes.
Write a commit message (e.g., â€œAdded hello.Râ€) and click Commit to main.
Click Push Origin to upload the changes to GitHub.
